Authors: Chao Ge Wang, Shi-Liang Liu, Fang Wu
Title:
Two new species of Perenniporia (Polyporales,
Basidiomycota)
Abstract:
Two new species of Perenniporia, P. pseudotephropora and
P. subcorticola spp. nov., are introduced respectively from Brazil and
China based on morphological characteristics and molecular data. P.
pseudotephropora is characterized by perennial and pileate basidiocarps
with distinctly stratified tubes; a dimitic hyphal system with slightly
dextrinoid arboriform skeletal hyphae; globose, truncate, weakly
dextrinoid, cyanophilous basidiospores measuring 4.95.2 × 44.8 μm. P.
subcorticola is characterized resupinate basidiocarps, yellow pores with
thick dissepiments, tissues becoming dark in KOH, flexuous skeletal
hyphae, ellipsoid, truncate and slightly dextrinoid basidiospores
measuring 4.25 × 3.54.2 µm. In addition, P. corticola is
phylogenetically analyzed, and compared with relative species. The
morphological similar species and phylogenetically closely related
species to the two new species are discussed.
